content.description: Sit start on an okay undercling with your left and a bomber side pull on the right. Big throw up to a 1&1/2pad crimp, right hand pinch on the arete, then side pull near the top. Great climb with some strenuous moves and a pretty dicey top out.
content.location: Right side of the Heavenly Terrace

content.description: Start on the far right side of the heavenly terrace, make your way through some low side pulls and underclings (the crux), then over to the juggy block and follow the horizontal crack into the start of Blue Spotted Tail, make your way up the V1 and top out. Using the higher holds at the start is more like a V2-3 variation. Huge rocky shelf at the bottom is off otherwise you can basically walk through the crux.
content.location: Right to left on the Heavenly Terrace, could also go left to right the grade doesn’t change

content.description: You can either start on decent side pulls at waist height  or use the huge shelf at your feet and start at the juggy block halfway up the rock. Doesn’t change the grade/quality of the climb. Get high feet and put your weight into a Gaston off to the right. Set your feet and reach to the top. Starting further right and using the Gaston as a left hand side pull doesn’t change the grade, but it’s not nearly as fun. One of the best routes in the park.
content.location: Middle of the Heavenly Terrace Boulder.

content.description: Start with your hands in the slanted horizontal crack, make your way up using a crimp, get a high foot and reach for a sloper up to the left. Easy top out
A granite vertical wall with 4 amazing climbs. Best quality of rock in the park.
